intro: Tulipa ciliatula, commonly known as the fringed tulip, is a bulbous perennial plant native to Turkey. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, fringed petals that give it a unique appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 15–30 centimeters and produces showy flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow. Tulipa ciliatula prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its blooming period occurs in late spring, adding vibrant color to gardens during that time.
